properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Another thunderstorm strengthening near London will soak parts of Oxford, Elgin and Norfolk counties again. Additional local rainfall amounts of 25 to 50 mm in under an hour are likely with this thunderstorm. Communities possibly affected include St. Thomas, Aylmer, Tillsonburg and Simcoe. Wind gusts to 90 km/h are also possible. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes.
Expires: 2019-07-28T23:59:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-28T21:51:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1246637562.2019
Area: Simcoe - Delhi - Norfolk, London - Parkhill - Eastern Middlesex County, St. Thomas - Aylmer - Eastern Elgin County, Woodstock - Tillsonburg - Oxford County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 4:09 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles.
Expires: 2019-07-28T23:08:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-28T20:09:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3595484512.2019
Area: Sarnia - Petrolia - Western Lambton County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wildfire smoke is causing poor air quality and locally reduced visibilities at times. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. People with lung diseases, such as asthma and COPD, can be particularly sensitive to air pollution. They will generally experience more serious health effects at lower levels. Pollution can aggravate their diseases, leading to increased medication use, doctor and emergency room visits, and hospital visits. For more information please visit Alberta Health Services at www.albertahealthservices.ca/news/air.aspx. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-07-29T13:35:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, Alberta Environment and Parks, Alberta Health, Alberta Health Services, 2019-07-28T21:36:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3881159067.2019
Area: Mackenzie Co. near Bistcho Lake, Mackenzie Co. near Rainbow Lake Zama Lake and Chateh, Mackenzie Co. near Zama City, Mackenzie Co. near Indian Cabins and Steen River, Mackenzie Co. near Meander River and Lutose, Mackenzie Co. near High Level and Bushe River Res., Co. of Northern Lights near Paddle Prairie Smt, Mackenzie Co. near the Caribou Mountains, Mackenzie Co. near Fort Vermilion, Mackenzie Co. near John D'or Prairie and Fox Lake, Mackenzie Co. near La CrÃªte and Buffalo Head Prairie, Mackenzie Co. near the Tallcree and Wadlin Lake Reserves

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The heat will persist through Tuesday evening. The combined values of temperature and humidity will give humidex values of 35 to 38. Limit physical activities. Drink lots of water, even before feeling thirsty, and keep cool. Check up on elderly family members, friends and neighbours. Please be sure that they are cool and drinking water. Look for cool places, such as shadows from trees, pool, shower or bath, and air conditioned places like public buildings. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-29T03:50:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-28T19:51:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2139545702.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: There is potential for severe thunderstorms this evening with damaging winds, torrential downpours and large hail being the main threats. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing quarter-sized hail and damaging winds in excess of 90 km/h. At 2:40 PM CDT Doppler RADAR indicated that this line of severe thunderstorms stretched from Sandilands to about 15 km south of Hadashville and was moving toward the northeast at 30 km/h. At 2:15 PM the public reported quarter-sized hail with these thunderstorms. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury.
Expires: 2019-07-28T22:41:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-28T19:43:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3160325739.2019

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: This afternoon and this evening, conditions will be favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Boaters may be surprised by strong wind gusts over bodies of water. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-29T03:59:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-28T20:03:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0896751049.2019

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions will be favourable for thunderstorms with squalls of 35 knots, torrential downpours with sudden very low visibility late this afternoon into this evening. Frequent lightning is also expected with some of the thunderstorms. ### Poor to very poor visibility may contribute to voyage delays and make marine navigation hazardous. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts. There remains potential for thunderstorms to occur over portions of western and northern New Brunswick this evening. Some of these storms could become severe early this evening. Heavy downpours of rain and strong wind gusts are the main threats. However, small hail is also possible. ### Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-29T01:59:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-28T20:30:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2112135211.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A cluster of thunderstorms continues to soak the southern half of Oxford county and neighbouring portions of Elgin and Norfolk counties. Communities affected include Aylmer, Tillsonburg and possibly Simcoe. The main threats are torrential downpours giving 50 mm of rain in under an hour and wind gusts near 90 km/h until about 6:30 PM. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes.

properties.Title: Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Squalls with wind gusts up to 45 knots and frequent lightning are expected in the next two hours. Severe thunderstorms over Lake St. Clair is moving southeastwards at 20 knots. More storms are developing northwest of Lake St. Clair. Radar also indicated that some of these storms has the potential to produce waterspout as well. ### Keep in mind that waterspouts cannot be seen at night and may strike suddenly. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Summary:

Thunderstorms are forecast to continue to intensify this afternoon as they move eastward. Some of these thunderstorms may reach severe levels with hail to the size of loonies and wind gusts in excess of 90 km/h. properties.Title: Tornado Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 5:44 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm that is possibly producing a tornado. Damaging winds, large hail and locally intense rainfall are also possible. This dangerous thunderstorm is just northeast of Grande Pointe, moving east at 40 km/h. This dangerous thunderstorm will be near: Arkwood around 6:00 PM EDT. Some locations which may be impacted include: Arkwood, Oungah, Darrell, Eberts, Appledore, Thorncliffe, Louisville, Vosburg, Van Horne, Kent Bridge and Northwood. A brief tornado is possible. Wind gusts to 100 km/h, torrential downpours giving 50 mm or more in an hour and frequent lightning are possible. ### Tornado warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing tornadoes.
Expires: 2019-07-28T23:30:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-28T21:45:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1944025334.2019
